channel.title: Connecting! Ip error!
channel.description:
ok guys well when my hosters ip change obviously the EGUI ip needs to be changed :rolleyes:
is there a way of doing this without having players downloading a whole new client? :confused:
rep++ to anyone that can solve problem

item.title: Connecting! Ip error!
item.dc:creator: @05bgoodson 05bgoodson
item.description:
@05bgoodson wrote:

so i’ll need to make a new EGUI every time the ip changes and get every player to download the new EGUI and replace it with the old one? in that case why does the client ask for no-ips at some points in the code?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 09, 2010, 08:51:48 am[/size][hr]please someone help me out…

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting! Ip error!
item.dc:creator: @DJ2oo7 -DJ2oo7-
item.description:
@DJ2oo7 wrote:

Fatal Desire:

YA your gonna have to make a new client bro. Sorry :\

No? He just have to update the egui.java and upload it again

item.title: Connecting! Ip error!
item.dc:creator: @05bgoodson 05bgoodson
item.description:
@05bgoodson wrote:

well the server etc was working with a no-ip… that was until his ip completley changed, not his pc ip but whole ip. and after updating EGUI onto clients (only 5 of us currently play as it is being tested) we decided that we just need to sort the problem so that i can put the server online 24/7. all i need is somehow a way for the EGUI to get the ip off of the no-ip that i have added inplace of whatever no-ip i was there before. and we have a no-ip running, by that i mean it has the DUC i think so its updates… anyone else now more able to help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting! Ip error!
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

Owned_Pl0xs:

If it was a # ip, you’re out of luck. If it’s a no-ip, change the IP in the no-ip to the new one.

But, still in EGUI.java it would still be example.no-ip.org/info.biz or any other ones…I think you could do something like this with MySQL, although I’ve never used it myself.

Read full topic
